content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
The structure resembles a toy train with approximately 20 building blocks arranged in 2-3 layers depending on the section.

## Spatial Relationships
The structure consists of:
- Base layer: 4 red arch blocks forming the "wheels" of the train
- Middle layer (from front to back):
  * Front section: Yellow horizontal platform with green blocks and a blue+orange "house" structure
  * Middle section: Blue cube, yellow blocks (including cylinders)
  * Rear section: Orange cube, green blocks

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on the structure, I need the following blocks:
- Block #1 (red arch) - used 2 times
- Block #2 (red arch) - used 2 times
- Block #3 (blue cube) - used 2 times
- Block #4 (green cube) - used 3 times
- Block #5 (orange cube) - used 1 time
- Block #7 (blue vertical rectangle) - used 1 time
- Block #8 (green horizontal rectangle) - used 1 time
- Block #9 (green vertical rectangle) - used 1 time
- Block #10 (yellow horizontal rectangle) - used 1 time
- Block #11 (yellow vertical rectangle) - used 2 times
- Block #12 (yellow horizontal rectangle) - used 1 time
- Block #13 (yellow half-cylinder) - used 2 times
- Block #15 (orange cube) - used 1 time
- Block #16 (orange triangular roof) - used 1 time

# Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 1
   Step2: Move block with index 1
   Step3: Move block with index 2
   Step4: Move block with index 2
   Step5: Move block with index 10
   Step6: Move block with index 12
   Step7: Move block with index 4
   Step8: Move block with index 4
   Step9: Move block with index 7
   Step10: Move block with index 16
   Step11: Move block with index 3
   Step12: Move block with index 11
   Step13: Move block with index 11
   Step14: Move block with index 13
   Step15: Move block with index 13
   Step16: Move block with index 3
   Step17: Move block with index 15
   Step18: Move block with index 5
   Step19: Move block with index 9
   Step20: Move block with index 8
   Step21: Move block with index 4
}
```
